eligibility_verification.title: Eligibility and Benefits Verification Services
eligibility_verification.subtitle: Verify insurance coverage in real-time to reduce denials and secure faster payments.

sections.heading: Optimize Revenue with Pre-Service Eligibility Checks
sections.description: Inaccurate or missing insurance information is one of the top reasons for denied or delayed claims. At Ardur Healthcare, our eligibility and benefits verification services help eliminate those problems before they occur. Whether you're verifying Medicaid, Medicare, or commercial plans, we ensure you have the information needed to bill correctly and get paid faster.
features: Coverage Confirmation: Real-time insurance eligibility verification for Medicare, Medicaid, and commercial payers.
Benefit Details: Detailed summaries of co-pays, coinsurance, deductibles, and out-of-pocket max.
Authorization Checks: Identification of services that require prior authorization.
Plan Limitations: Review of service-specific coverage limitations (e.g., therapy visit caps).
Insurance Gaps: Early detection of inactive coverage or termination before care is rendered.

sections.heading: Our Eligibility Verification Process
sections.description: We follow a rigorous, standardized workflow to ensure no detail is missed during verification:
steps: Data Capture: Collect insurance details from your EMR/scheduling system or intake forms.
Primary Source Verification: Cross-check eligibility via payer portals, EDI, and direct insurer calls.
Documentation: Provide a structured, easy-to-read benefits breakdown for your front desk and billing team.
Flagging Requirements: Highlight pre-authorization needs and missing data points.
Daily Reports: Deliver eligibility reports before each day’s appointments so your staff can stay ahead.

sections.heading: Why Choose Ardur Healthcare for Benefits Verification?
features: Specialty-Tailored Checks: We adapt our process to your specialty, mental health, ortho, physical therapy, etc.
Medicaid & Medicare Experts: From verifying Medicaid eligibility to navigating Medicare rules, we’ve got it covered.
Custom Reporting: Daily and weekly verification summaries customized to your operations.
Claim-Ready Data: We ensure your billing team receives clean, coded coverage info they can act on.
Compliance Guaranteed: Fully HIPAA-compliant workflows and secure access protocols.

sections.heading: Ready to Eliminate Coverage Guesswork?
sections.description: Let our experts handle your insurance verification so your team can focus on care, not paperwork.

sections.heading: FAQs about Our Eligibility and Benefits Verification Services

faqs.question: What is eligibility and benefits verification in medical billing?
faqs.answer: It’s the process of confirming a patient’s insurance coverage, plan details, and prior authorization needs before rendering services to reduce denials and delays.

faqs.question: Do you handle Medicaid eligibility verification?
faqs.answer: Yes. We verify Medicaid coverage across all states, including state-specific plans and Medicaid Managed Care programs.

faqs.question: How quickly do I get verification reports before appointments?
faqs.answer: We deliver eligibility reports ahead of patient appointments, usually at least 24 hours in advance, so your front desk and billing team are fully prepared.

faqs.question: Can you verify benefits for Medicare Advantage plans?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We verify benefits for all Medicare Advantage plans and identify any service restrictions or referral needs.

faqs.question: What information do you need to begin eligibility checks?
faqs.answer: Basic patient demographics, insurance ID, and scheduled service details. We can pull this directly from your EHR or intake forms.

prior_authorization.title: Prior Authorization Services
prior_authorization.subtitle: Accelerate prior authorizations and reduce delays across payers and procedures.

sections.heading: Eliminate Authorization Delays with Expert Support
sections.description: Insurance-mandated prior authorizations can disrupt care and cash flow if not managed properly. At Ardur Healthcare, our prior authorization services help reduce administrative burden, cut down approval time, and prevent claim denials. We handle the entire process, from payer communication to status tracking, so you can stay focused on patient care.
features: Procedure Approvals: Fast, accurate submissions for pharmacy and procedural authorizations.
Multi-Payer Expertise: Familiarity with UHC, Humana, BCBS, TRICARE, Aetna, and Medicaid plans like Molina.
Portal Navigation: Skilled in platforms like Availity, CoverMyMeds, and CareMark.
Status Monitoring: Regular follow-ups to track, escalate, and resolve pending cases.
Integrated Documentation: We collect and submit clinical notes, CPT codes, and medical necessity data.

sections.heading: Our Prior Authorization Process
sections.description: A proactive, payer-specific approach that ensures faster approvals and reduced denials:
steps: Case Intake: We gather complete patient and service details from your EHR or intake team.
Medical Necessity Review: Clinical documentation is validated and aligned with payer criteria.
Submission to Payers: Requests submitted through EDI, portals, or direct communication channels.
Follow-Up & Escalation: We monitor approval timelines and escalate urgent requests when needed.
Status Reporting: You receive real-time updates and final determination notifications.

sections.heading: Why Choose Ardur Healthcare for Prior Authorizations?
features: Specialist-Level Payer Knowledge: From TRICARE to Molina, we know each payer’s playbook.
Faster Turnaround Times: We cut authorization time with efficient workflows and aggressive follow-up.
Dedicated Authorization Experts: Every request is handled by trained specialists who understand payer requirements and ensure faster, more accurate approvals.
Full Integration with Your Billing: Our prior auth team coordinates with coding and claims to prevent downstream denials.
HIPAA-Compliant Systems: Data privacy and security are built into our entire process.

sections.heading: Ready to Improve Your Approval Rates?
sections.description: Let Ardur Healthcare take over your prior authorization process: minimize delays, improve patient access, and reduce denials.

sections.heading: FAQs about Our Prior Authorization Services

faqs.question: Do you handle both pharmacy and medical prior authorizations?
faqs.answer: Yes. We manage prior authorizations for medications, procedures, and diagnostic services across all major payers and platforms like CoverMyMeds.

faqs.question: Which insurance companies do you support for prior authorizations?
faqs.answer: We support prior auths for UHC, Aetna, Humana, TRICARE, Molina, Anthem, BCBS, and many regional and Medicare plans.

faqs.question: How long does it take to complete a prior authorization?
faqs.answer: Most authorizations are completed within 24 - 72 hours, depending on payer timelines and urgency. We expedite urgent cases as needed.

faqs.question: Can you integrate with our EHR and billing software?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We work with your current systems, no need to switch platforms or retrain staff.

faqs.question: How can outsourcing prior authorizations improve our revenue cycle?
faqs.answer: Our experts reduce denials, speed up care delivery, and free your internal team from time-consuming back-and-forth with payers.

provider_credentialing.title: Provider Credentialing and Enrollment Services
provider_credentialing.subtitle: Simplify credentialing and enrollment to stay payer-connected and revenue-ready.

sections.heading: Efficient Credentialing That Keeps You In-Network
sections.description: Payer enrollment delays, form rejections, or outdated CAQH profiles can stall revenue and patient care. Our credentialing and enrollment services ensure your providers are accurately listed, properly credentialed, and ready to bill from day one.
features: Medicare and Medicaid Enrollment: Navigate complex Medicare/Medicaid rules, including PECOS and state-specific Medicaid systems.
CAQH Management: Keep CAQH ProView and payer portals updated and attested on your behalf.
Commercial Payer: From Aetna to Blue Cross and beyond, we manage credentialing across all major plans.
Ongoing Recredentialing: Stay current with periodic updates and payer-driven re-verifications.
Multi-State Licensing: We assist in organizing paperwork for providers practicing across multiple states or joining new networks.

sections.heading: Our Credentialing & Enrollment Process
sections.description: Our structured workflow ensures transparency, compliance, and quick onboarding across all payer types:
steps: Information Collection: Gather provider and group details, including licensure, NPI, DEA, CV, and malpractice history.
CAQH Setup & Management: Complete registration, load documentation, and manage ongoing attestations.
Application Submission: Complete and submit applications to Medicare, Medicaid, and private payers accurately and on time.
Follow-Up & Status Checks: Track submissions, resolve deficiencies, and keep you updated throughout the process.
Finalization & Payer Approval: Confirm enrollment, load provider into billing systems, and provide verification for payer directories.

sections.heading: Why Choose Ardur Healthcare for Provider Credentialing?
features: Faster Approvals: Reduce enrollment time and go in-network sooner.
Fewer Application Errors: We handle the paperwork and prevent costly delays.
Unified Management: Credentialing and billing are managed under one roof for seamless operations.
Audit-Ready Documentation: Every step is documented and stored securely for compliance readiness.
Multi-Payer Expertise: We’re experienced with national carriers and state-level variations.

sections.heading: Ready to Accelerate Your Payer Enrollment?
sections.description: Avoid delays that impact your revenue and reputation. Partner with Ardur Healthcare for efficient, error-free provider credentialing and enrollment support across the U.S.

sections.heading: FAQs about Our Provider Credentialing & Enrollment Services

faqs.question: What’s the difference between provider credentialing and enrollment?
faqs.answer: Credentialing verifies a provider’s qualifications. Enrollment is the process of joining payer networks to bill for services. Both are essential to receive reimbursements.

faqs.question: How long does the provider credentialing process take?
faqs.answer: It varies by payer, but credentialing typically takes 30 - 120 days. We expedite the process through complete, error-free applications and timely follow-ups.

faqs.question: Do you assist with Medicare and Medicaid credentialing?
faqs.answer: Yes. We handle Medicare PECOS enrollment and work with state Medicaid agencies, including Molina, Aetna Better Health, and more.

faqs.question: Can you manage my CAQH profile?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We update CAQH ProView, upload required documents, and ensure timely attestations to prevent delays.

faqs.question: Do you offer support for recredentialing or joining new states/networks?
faqs.answer: Yes. We handle recredentialing and multi-state applications for expanding practices or new payer contracts.

charge_entry.title: Charge Entry Services
charge_entry.subtitle: Accurate charge entry that drives clean claims, fewer errors, and faster payouts.
charge_entry.description: Charge entry is one of the most critical steps in the medical billing cycle. If charges aren’t entered correctly, even the best clinical care can go unpaid. At Ardur Healthcare, we help providers maintain clean claims, accurate records, and faster payments by meticulously managing every aspect of charge entry.
features: Manual & Automated Charge Entry: We enter charges from super bills, EMRs, or encounter forms with exceptional accuracy.
Demo Entry: Patient demographics, insurance, and provider information are properly linked to ensure clean billing.
Code Validation: We double-check ICD-10, CPT, and HCPCS codes for accuracy before submission.
Modifiers & Fee Schedules: We apply correct modifiers and payer-specific fee structures to reduce rejections.
Charge Audit & Edits: Final review before submission ensures completeness and compliance.
process: Data Retrieval: Capture charges from EHRs, scanned forms, or billing sheets.
Demo Linking: Match patient demographics with corresponding encounters to ensure data integrity.
CPT/ICD Coding Verification: Ensure codes are complete, relevant, and linked correctly.
Charge Posting: Enter charges into billing software using payer-specific rules and contract terms.
Quality Check: Pre-billing QA step to avoid denials due to missing or incorrect data.
why_choose: Accuracy-Focused: Our team enters and validates charges with over 99% accuracy.
Faster Turnaround: We process charges within 24–48 hours to keep your revenue flowing.
Compliance-Ready: We follow payer and specialty-specific billing rules, reducing audit risks.
Software-Compatible: Seamlessly work with top systems like AdvancedMD, Athenahealth, eClinicalWorks, and more.
End-to-End Billing Integration: Our charge entry syncs with your eligibility, coding, and AR workflows.

faqs.question: What is charge entry in the medical billing process?
faqs.answer: Charge entry is the process of entering billing codes, charges, and patient details into a billing system to generate claims. It directly impacts reimbursement speed and accuracy.

faqs.question: How does incorrect charge entry affect my revenue cycle?
faqs.answer: Inaccurate or incomplete charge entry can lead to claim denials, delays, underpayments, or even compliance issues. Clean charge entry ensures timely and full payments.

faqs.question: Do you support both manual and EHR-integrated charge entry?
faqs.answer: Yes. We handle manual forms as well as EHR-integrated submissions from leading platforms like AdvancedMD, DrChrono, and Athenahealth.

faqs.question: Can you manage specialty-specific charge posting requirements?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Our team is experienced across multiple specialties, applying appropriate modifiers, units, and payer-specific guidelines.

faqs.question: What makes Ardur’s charge entry services more reliable?
faqs.answer: We combine expert billing knowledge, system-specific proficiency, and stringent QA to ensure 99%+ accuracy and faster claim submission.

medical_coding.title: Medical Coding Services
medical_coding.subtitle: Specialty-specific coding that ensures compliance and maximizes reimbursements.
medical_coding.description: At Ardur Healthcare, we offer certified medical coding services that support compliant, high-performing billing operations for healthcare providers nationwide. Our coders are trained in CPT, ICD-11, and HCPCS Level II codes, helping you avoid delays, denials, and audit risks. Whether you're an independent physician or a multi-provider group, we ensure that each encounter is translated into correct, reimbursable codes.
features: Procedure & Diagnosis Coding: Assign accurate CPT, ICD-11, and HCPCS codes aligned with payer guidelines.
Specialty-Specific Coding: Coding expertise tailored to specialties like behavioral health, cardiology, dermatology, and more.
Code Auditing: Identify under-coded or over-coded encounters and ensure documentation supports coding decisions.
Modifiers & Bundling Checks: Prevent denials by applying correct modifiers and unbundling when appropriate.
Coding Updates & Compliance: We stay up to date with CMS, AMA, and payer-specific coding changes so you don’t have to.
process: Medical Record Review: Review clinical documentation or SOAP notes for coding accuracy.
Code Assignment: Assign appropriate CPT, ICD-11, and HCPCS codes based on payer and specialty rules.
Cross-Verification: Dual checks by certified coders to ensure coding accuracy and compliance.
Coding Edits: Check for bundling issues, medical necessity, and missing documentation.
Feedback Loop: Provide feedback to providers or office staff to improve future documentation.
why_choose: Certified Coders (AAPC & AHIMA): Trained professionals handling each case with precision and attention to detail.
Multi-Specialty Coding Expertise: Proficient in behavioral health, physical therapy, wound care, and more.
Error-Free Claims: We reduce your risk of denials by ensuring codes match documentation and payer guidelines.
Full Compliance: We stay current with OIG, HIPAA, and CMS regulations to help you avoid penalties or audits.
Seamless Integration: We work with all major billing platforms, including Kareo, AdvancedMD, Athenahealth, and others.

faqs.question: What’s the difference between medical billing and medical coding?
faqs.answer: Coding involves translating clinical documentation into standardized CPT, ICD-11, and HCPCS codes. Billing uses those codes to submit claims for reimbursement. Both are essential parts of the revenue cycle.

faqs.question: Are your coders certified?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our team includes AAPC- and AHIMA-certified coders who undergo ongoing training and quality audits to stay current with industry standards.

faqs.question: What specialties do you offer medical coding for?
faqs.answer: We offer medical coding for a wide range of specialties, including mental health, cardiology, physical therapy, dermatology, orthopedics, and more.

faqs.question: How do you ensure coding accuracy?
faqs.answer: Every chart is reviewed by a certified coder and cross-verified. We also run edits for bundling, modifier use, and medical necessity to ensure compliance.

faqs.question: Can you work with our existing billing software?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We support all major EHR and billing platforms, including eClinicalWorks, Kareo, Tebra, AdvancedMD, and more.

claim_submission_follow_up.name: Claim Submission and Follow-Up Services
claim_submission_follow_up.title: Clean claim submissions and persistent follow-up to secure timely payments.
claim_submission_follow_up.subtitle: Precision-Driven Claim Submission & Tracking
claim_submission_follow_up.description: At Ardur Healthcare, we understand that even the smallest billing error can result in claim rejection or payment delays. Our claim submission and follow-up services ensure your claims are accurate, properly formatted, and followed up on every time. From CMS-1500 form accuracy to clearinghouse rejections, we proactively manage your claims until payment is received.
process: Claim Status Inquiries
Denial Management & Appeals
Underpayment Reviews
Rejections vs. Denials
Aging AR Clean-Up
why_choose: 99% Clean Claim Rate
Platform Agnostic: We work with AdvancedMD, Kareo, Tebra, Athenahealth, etc.
Experienced Billing Team trained in payer-specific rules (Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial)
HIPAA-Compliant Workflows with encrypted systems
Complete Visibility with transparent reporting and real-time updates

faqs.question: What is claim scrubbing, and why is it important?
faqs.answer: Claim scrubbing involves reviewing claims for errors before submission. It reduces rejections and denials by ensuring complete and accurate information.

faqs.question: How quickly do you follow up on unpaid claims?
faqs.answer: Our AR follow-up team initiates contact with payers within 15-20 days of claim submission and continues until the claim is resolved or escalated.

faqs.question: Do you handle both paper and electronic claims?
faqs.answer: Yes, we submit claims electronically where possible, but also manage paper claims when required by certain payers or services.

faqs.question: How do you manage claim denials?
faqs.answer: We identify the root cause of denial, correct it (if provider-side), and either resubmit or file a detailed appeal with supporting documentation.

faqs.question: Can I track the status of my claims?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We provide regular status reports, including pending claims, denials, and aging summaries, ensuring full transparency.

payment_posting_reconciliation.name: Payment Posting and Reconciliation Services
payment_posting_reconciliation.title: Track every payment with precise posting and full reconciliation accuracy.
payment_posting_reconciliation.subtitle: Precision-Driven Payment Posting for Reliable Revenue
payment_posting_reconciliation.description: At Ardur Healthcare, our payment posting services transform EOBs, ERAs, and patient payments into accurate financial data that powers your revenue cycle. Whether payments come in electronically or manually, we post them with precision, ensuring your records are clean, your revenue is transparent, and your AR stays under control. Our reconciliation process ensures that your bank statements, payer deposits, and EHR ledgers all match.
process: Daily Deposit Matching
Exception Reporting
Denial & Partial Payment Identification
Patient Balance Updates
Audit-Ready Records
why_choose: EHR/RCM Compatibility: We support systems like AdvancedMD, eClinicalWorks, Tebra, Kareo, NextGen, and more
Clean Reconciliation: Every payment is traceable—no gaps, no guesswork
ERA & Manual Posting Experts: Skilled in both electronic and paper-based posting
Fast Turnaround: Payments are posted within 24 - 48 hours of receipt
Insightful Reporting: Get real-time payment summaries and payer trend analysis

faqs.question: What is payment posting in medical billing?
faqs.answer: Payment posting involves recording insurance and patient payments into the billing system using EOBs or ERAs, helping maintain accurate financial and AR records.

faqs.question: What types of payments do you handle?
faqs.answer: We post insurance remittances, co-pays, deductibles, patient payments, secondary claims, and more, both electronically and manually.

faqs.question: How do you reconcile payments?
faqs.answer: We match each posted payment with actual deposits and resolve any mismatches by reviewing remits or contacting the payer.

faqs.question: Can you handle electronic and manual payment posting?
faqs.answer: Yes. We are skilled in both ERA auto-posting and manual EOB payment entry, including applying adjustments, write-offs, and denials.

faqs.question: Which systems do you support for payment posting?
faqs.answer: We work with leading platforms including eClinicalWorks, AdvancedMD, Kareo, Tebra, Epic, and more for seamless posting and reconciliation.

denial_management.name: Denial Management Services
denial_management.title: Resolve denials fast and recover lost revenue with expert denial management.
denial_management.subtitle: End-to-End Claim Denial Management for Healthcare Providers
denial_management.description: Ardur Healthcare provides denial management services that help you recover what you’ve earned and prevent future denials through data-driven strategies. We work with all major payers, Medicare, Medicaid, commercial insurers, and regional MCOs, to deliver measurable improvements in claim denial management.
process: Denial Identification from ERAs, EOBs, and clearinghouses
Root Cause Categorization (coding, eligibility, authorization, documentation)
Resolution & Appeal with justifications and attachments
Process Improvement using payer-specific feedback
Regular Denial Reporting to billing and compliance teams
why_choose: Experienced Denial Analysts skilled in complex payer rules
Most denials processed within 48 hours
All-Payer Coverage: Medicare, Medicaid, UHC, Aetna, Cigna, and more
Certified Coders for high coding accuracy
Strategic Denial Prevention, not just rework

faqs.question: What is denial management in medical billing?
faqs.answer: Denial management involves identifying, correcting, appealing, and preventing insurance claim denials to improve revenue cycle efficiency.

faqs.question: How fast do you process and resubmit denied claims?
faqs.answer: Our team typically reworks and resubmits denied claims within 24 - 48 hours, depending on the complexity.

faqs.question: Can you handle appeals for complex payer denials?
faqs.answer: Yes, we manage appeals across all major payers, including detailed documentation, submission, and follow-up.

faqs.question: What are the common causes of medical claim denials?
faqs.answer: Coding errors, eligibility issues, lack of prior authorization, and documentation gaps are among the most common causes.

faqs.question: Do you offer denial analytics and reporting?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We provide detailed denial reports with insights into trends, payer behavior, and root causes for continuous improvement.

ar_management.name: Accounts Receivable Management
ar_management.title: Accounts Receivable Management Services
ar_management.subtitle: Recover aged claims and improve cash flow with expert AR follow-up support.
ar_management.description: At Ardur Healthcare, our accounts receivable management services help you recover outstanding claims efficiently while maintaining compliance and payer relations. Whether you're a solo provider or a multi-specialty group, we bring structure and speed to your medical receivables management process.
why_choose: Specialized AR Team: Experts in managing aged claims and difficult payers.
Reduced Aging AR: We aim to keep AR over 90 days below industry benchmarks.
End-to-End RCM Integration: Seamless coordination with coding, billing, and denial management.
Payer Expertise: Medicare, Medicaid, and commercial plans like UHC, Cigna, and Blue Cross.
Transparent Communication: Always know the status of your collections with real-time reporting.
process: AR Review & Segmentation: Organize receivables by payer, age, balance, and denial reason.
Strategic Follow-Up: Prioritize and act on high-value or time-sensitive claims first.
Payer Outreach: Communicate with insurers to resolve disputes, reprocess claims, or escalate as needed.
Patient Coordination: Assist patients with statements, payment plans, or secondary coverage guidance.
AR Reporting: Share actionable monthly reports with key metrics and recovery outcomes.
services: Aging AR Analysis: Prioritize claims based on age, value, and denial risk.
Insurance Follow-Up: Regular outreach to payers for claim status and resolution.
Appeals & Resubmissions: Rework denied claims and pursue timely appeals.
Patient Balance Management: Assist with statements and follow-up on out-of-pocket balances.
Reporting & Insights: Deliver detailed AR reports and recovery metrics by payer and aging bucket.

faqs.question: What is AR management in medical billing?
faqs.answer: AR management is the process of tracking, following up, and recovering payments from insurance companies and patients for rendered healthcare services.

faqs.question: How do you reduce aging accounts receivable?
faqs.answer: We prioritize claims based on aging, value, and payer rules, ensuring timely follow-up and resubmissions to prevent write-offs.

faqs.question: Can you help with patient collections, too?
faqs.answer: Yes, we support patient balance follow-up with clear statements and friendly communication to improve collections.

faqs.question: What’s included in your AR reports?
faqs.answer: Reports include aging summaries, payer-specific trends, denial root causes, and recovery performance metrics.

faqs.question: How does AR management support the overall revenue cycle?
faqs.answer: Effective AR management ensures timely reimbursement, reduces claim aging, improves cash flow, and supports long-term financial stability.
